net.sf.michaelo.activedirectory

Class ActiveDirectoryDcLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.michaelo.activedirectory.ActiveDirectoryDcLocator

  • public class ActiveDirectoryDcLocator
extends Object
    A Java implementation of the DC locator process by mimicking the DsGetDcName() function. It utilizes DNS-based discovery (see ActiveDirectoryDnsLocator) followed by an LDAP ping (see ActiveDirectoryLdapPinger).

    The behavior mimics the mentioned Windows function by observation, traffic captures and Samba's source code inspection, but will never fully cover its functionality. More specifically, the following differs:

    • RPCs through DcLocatorRequest.setComputerName(String) are not supported, thus the location happens on the local host only. (deprecated for removal)
    • Flags DcLocatorRequest.Flag.DS_FORCE_REDISCOVERY, DcLocatorRequest.Flag.DS_BACKGROUND_ONLY, DcLocatorRequest.Flag.DS_AVOID_SELF, DcLocatorRequest.Flag.DS_DIRECTORY_SERVICE_PREFERRED, DcLocatorRequest.Flag.DS_GOOD_TIMESERV_PREFERRED are silently ignored.
    • Flag DcLocatorRequest.Flag.DS_IS_FLAT_NAME is not supported.
    • Location via GUID is not supported at all.

    Note: This class uses JUL to print log messages, enable at least level FINE to see output.

    • Method Detail

      • locate

        public DomainControllerInfo locate(DcLocatorRequest request)
                            throws NamingException
        Locates a suitable domain controller.
        Parameters:
        request - the DC locator request
        Returns:
        the located domain controller information, never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if request is null
        OperationNotSupportedException - if DcLocatorRequest#getComputerName() is not null
        ConfigurationException - if the request contains incompatible parameters or the local host name could not be determined
        NamingException - if the locator process has failed, cause may contain details
